												I REALLY want to like this game, but at the moment I really don't think it's worth 60 dollars. I've spent a little time with the game and I like some of the core functions of the game. It looks beautiful and almost every core function is an upgrade over Just Cause 2. Driving is much improved over the last game, but still doesn't hold a candle to the driving in something like GTA and I don't feel like there is a huge variety for land vehicles like there were in JC2. There are a lot of tacked on things that I don't enjoy: namely the whole gear and upgrade system. I feel like some of the game is essentially locked down until the player does all these gimmicky challenges that are pretty much bs. The rebel drop system has issues too, there are too many restrictions on it; you need to have a certain amount of beacons and on top of that, each vehicle has a cooldown. The developers should have implemented one or the other seeing as it's very common for dropped vehicles to just self destruct. The game also has some unsatisfactory performance on my system. I'm running an 8150 and a 780 which should more or less satisfy the requirements, however my gpu is under-utilized (running 60-70% gpu usage as shown by MSI Afterburner) and I get framerates anywhere from the low 30s to high 50s. My settings are mostly set to high, with shadows on medium, no AA and motion blur off. My advice would be to wait until someone makes a mod to bypass the challenges and maybe then consider the game. Personally I will keep playing it because I can't refund it at this point and the game is ok. If you see it anywhere for less than 40 bucks I think that is a worthwhile price, but I can't recommend this game at the full 60 dollar price.EDIT: I'ver found some mods that adress my issues with the gameplay: http://justcause3mods.com/mods/unlock-all-gear-mods/ http://justcause3mods.com/mods/no-rebel-drop-timers/ http://justcause3mods.com/mods/no-intro/ http://justcause3mods.com/mods/infinite-beacons/ . Game is still isn't perfect and I'm still getting some notably iffy performance, I still think it's not worth 60 dollars, but these mods make the game so much more fun to play.EDIT2: A ton of mods were broken last month including some of the ones I linked. Game performance is still meh at best. Don't pay the full $60.

												after about 50 hours in the game, it's time to write a review about it:In a year dominated by brilliant open-world games, Just Cause 3 still manages to make its mark in style. In a way, it’s the happy-go-lucky sibling of Metal Gear Solid 5, with both games following war-weary, bearded freedom fighters catching up with old friends, revisiting past glories and attempting to save the world just one last time. There’s no stealth, of course – Rico Rodriguez only has one volume setting, which is LOUD – and Just Cause 3 has no pretensions to art or cultural significance. It just wants to p.a.r.t.y. and cause a few big bangs along the way.This is GTA 5 without the clever script and social satire but with the destruction dial turned up to max. It’s the game Saints Row wishes it could be. It’s also the game that has more fun with physics than any game since Portal 2, and quite possibly the silliest, most overblown, most downright entertaining game of late 2015. It’s the Just Cause that you knew a Just Cause could one day be.a few words:i'm aware there is some big Fps drops in the game with AMD card specially, but if you have a good RIG, let's say a 980GTX, the game runs smooth at 50 fps ultra settings in 1440P.i had a lot of fun playing that game, i'm nearly at the end of it, i think 53 hours and the 100% is accomplished.Pros:- Hudge openworld game with endless possibility of Physic fun- New Game + , you can re-oppres outposts for endless destructions.- many Weapons, vehicles.- The world of JC3 has been put alive with animals and encounters.- Mutli-tethering with the grappleCons:- FPS drops- no SLI support atm... couldnt get the game run at 4K with the other 980- no outfits for Rico- handling of cars and choppers.... are bad... very bad for mouse and Keyboard..especially Choppers, maybe a good  Xbox One Controller will do the trick ( the game itself has been badly and simply ported to PC without changing some controlls...)I must say, i had a lot of fun in JC3, one of my favorite games in 2015 and i'll continue to play it just for fun for some amazing stunts.GreezDeacon

												I love this game!Really, but coming from Just Cause 2 as a favourite all time sandbox.I just cant accept what this is.The only good thing this game has it going for itself are the god damn graphics! which arent even utilised well in terms of making a beautiful paradise-sic island.If you're here for the story, then you'll be disappointed, which is alright for a Just Cause game, because story has never been its thing.... Lets make it simple, in what this disappointment is compared to Just Cause 2. If you're expecting something like JC2 ofcourse.This SEQUEL, which is supposed to be an improvement, Gives you the following.Positives1. Wingsuit, For faster travel.2. Increased range for grapple.3. Good graphics. Really, they're amazing! Especially during rain.4. The AI is so much better, and this time they put up a fight.5. Physics, Everything has Physics! You'll love messing around with things in a more realistic way. (Thats a oxymoron with the grapple and all)Yep, those are the only improved things that you will LIKE in this SEQUEL, which is supposed to be an upgrade from the previous game.Its a sandbox game afterall.Lets talk about what a huge difference this game has between JC2 and itself.And trust me, these are all the negatives.1. Map is small, 1/3 of the map is ocean. Yep! Not like its a bad thing right? Wait till you see the wasteland up north, F**KING EMPTY! Everything on land looks downscaled OR upscaled, however you wanna take it. Why? Because everything is so frigging next to one another, the highway looks like some cheap rollercoaster and MORE than half the map is a f**king wasteland (You will understand once you play it) 2. FOV, its locked and its horrifying. I dont need to explain why and all of you guys that arent used to anything below 70 FOV. Going to have a hard time. Especially FPS Gamers.3. Progression. What the ♥♥♥♥ is that? Never heard of it in this game, Nowhere at all! Theres literally, NOTHING. To progress on, except for the fact that you can collect cars by driving them to garages. and the fact you can get them dropped for free. yep, No sense of management in this game compared to JC2.4. Villages and Bases. The BIGGEST disappointment is this! Villages are pretty F**king small. And REALLY, Small. The only big city you'll take over is the capital, and that too looks like a small village with a few big buildings, And every village has the same thing to destory it gets kinda repetitive, but atleast theres physics which you can utilise to make it extra fun.And the bases, Medici, is FULL of bases. There are more bases compared to villages in the town, it makes you look like almost as if its whole population is military personnel. And even in that, theres only a few Explosive items which you can blow up and some few new antennas, but this is nothing compared to JC2. really. It feels so stripped out.5. WEAPONS and VEHICLES! There we go, theres a handful of civilian vehicles and not a wide variety of weapons, at all. None!For vehicles, There are total 110 vehicles in JC2 if you own the DLC. (104 without them)While in Just Cause 3 ~80 Vehicles. Positive over JC2 is that they have better handling and design.1. You can not upgrade the vehicles in JC3 at all.2. ALL VEHICLES are speed locked. If you dive the airplane straight down from sky, it'll stay locked at its highest speed and wont increase any further for a massive speed dive.3. Vehicles explode if a pin is dropped while you're not inside For Weapaons, The catalog of weapons is cute in this game compared to JC2.1. 4 Assault Rifles, 1 LMG, 3 Rocket Launcher, 1 Grenade launcher. 2 Special FOW weapons. (Special strikes)2. No progression, at all! You cant upgrade these and they're as it is. Powerful all throughout the game.Thats it.... I know.6. Management and Airdrops, Theres nothing like this! In JC2, you had to get CHAOS and MONEY to have a drop at the cost of some money ofcourse so it gave you careful decisions you made. In this game, everything is free. you take over a base, you unlock it and get it dropped anywhere you want.Except theres a 40 minutes cooldown on tough military vehicles. I can go on more but these are the most critical disappointments one will face if you're moving from JC2.Other than that.This is a good game, except for the fact it faces a memory leak which gets annoying if you play more than 4 hours a day without shutting it down. (You can fix it by simply restarting the game)and you can find out you're having a memory leak with a weird stutter. Other than that.Game was damn good fun if i think of it as a stand-alone try-out instead of a Just Cause 2 follow up.

Posted: December 16, 2015
												I liked Just Cause 2 and wanted to support Just Cause 3 -- a singleplayer game (a dying breed?) with no DRM, no forced social network interaction, and a good PC port.Unfortunately, it instead turned into my first ever Steam refund request.  The game has 3rd-party DRM, and even worse, it's hidden in the EULA linked from the Steam page instead of advertised on the Steam page itself.The game also apparently has some forced social / leaderboard messages that cannot be disabled.Lastly, it is not even a good PC port as far as I can tell.  Performance seems to be poor across a variety of machines, and there is not yet a performance patch that I am aware of.  It runs poorly for me even at the starting area(s) of the game after adjusting settings down.One last note -- the game starts with a long, unskippable menu screen.  No loading even appears to happen during this (no hard drive activity), AND since this is a PC game, restarting the game multiple times is to be expected while adjusting settings.  Having a huge unskippable menu screen is very painful in this regard.Just Cause 2 was a very pleasant experience in the above areas, and Just Cause 3 is one of my saddest disappointments I have ever purchased.  Hopefully the refund goes through.  *edit*  The refund went smoothly through in 1 day, kudos to Valve.

Dunno why but I found the gamedesign, phantasmagoric (ab)use of grappling hook in particular very entertaining. I spent dozens maybe hundreds of hours just flying across San Esperito or Panau if you like, setting on fire anything which could have been set on fire, destroying anything which could have beed destroyed. When JC3 was announced I was happy and was looking forward.I was very surprised when I noticed that reviews of JC3 are mixed mostly due technical issues, but it is understood. To be honest, there are no technical problems for me, I am the lucky one. After 60 hours of playing I have got just one single crash, that is it. Everything is smooth and rock solid. But I do not deny there are some issues just because I do not have one.JC3 story is bland but c'mon, JC has never been about the story, it is pure madness full of explosions and silly travelling across the huge map.Gameplay is what a fan of JC franchise could have wished for - grappling hook, explosion, some racing, shooting explosion again, grappling hook, missile ride, shooting, grappling hook, explosion, shooting, explosion, grappling hook... Oh, did I mention the grappling hook?I am not disappointed, this game is true JC as I remembe and love. For the fans of JC it is must have. For the others - well, I would say try JC2 first, if you love it you will love JC3 too. If not then hands off, there is nothing new except some small but handy improvements (wingsuit!).I hope there are still some nasty dictators in the virtual world who need to be overthrown by Rico in the future! :)

Posted: September 15, 2016
 Great game let down by lack of polish/patches Well I was one of the lucky few to avoid the performance issues, however in-spite of those, the game will still attempt to ruin your afternoon...Let me start on a more positive note though... The game can be balls to the wall fun, it is also a very visually impressive game and the 'air of the clone brush' while still present in JC3, is far less obvious than in JC2. I personally had a great time exploring and traveling around Medici. HOWEVER.  It was also one of the most frustrating games I have played in a long time, not in terms of difficulty, but rather from how often I would get proverbially screwed by the game in one way or another. Let me rattle off a bit of a list of common grievances I had with it (written from the games perspective):You touched your heli down on a slight slope? Yeah it explodes and you dieYou jumped out of the heli 5ft from the floor? Time for Micheal Bay! Kaboom it goes!Oh you have traveled over to another part of the map? Well I haven't realised you are here, nothing has loaded and you clip through the terrain. Better restart your game Hombre.There was a femto second I could not communicate with the Square Enix servers? Yeah I am just going to slam you on pause to inform you.Hey you generated heat? Here is a pro-tip every time the radio states more units are inbound or heli's are coming, just look behind you, I always spawn them behind you! It's not obvious I swear.Wow check you out, Mr.SpeedDemon, oh wait, what's that? You took your car onto a bridge, yeah screw you, it flips and explodes.Hey I need you to complete this objective... What do you mean you can't? Oh that's right I haven't actually spawned it in. Teehee.Hey look here is an optional challenge. Hey nice going you are nearly done.... Oh damn it looks like a civilian 20ft up the road was spooked, crashed his car and died. Innocent hurt yo, you fail the challenge!(This is my favourite one:) Here protect this convoy which contains a mission critical objective and blow the bridge up so they can't chase you across it... Hey nice going you did it! Oh wow look your driver in the objective truck just literally drove his truck off the bridge... BTW you fail the mission, better restart! *JustCause3.exe has stopped working*There was many more niggles and issues I had with the game but those are the standout and memorable of the lot. It is honestly a shame because when the game was getting going with explosions, chaos and the like. It was incredible fun, but then some aggravating annoyance would crop up and ruin it. Nigh on game-breaking bug: If you do buy this game and play it with a mouse and keyboard, there is a mission whereupon you need to protect a plane of one 'Rosa Manuela' now the game was not apparently tested by QA because if you play the mission with the precision aiming upgrade turned on, the homing missiles on your plane do not work. If it doesn't work even after you turn off the precision aim upgrade, you need to launch steam in Big Picture mode and then relaunch the game and it will work... Yeah go figure why that's a thing. If you think you will just dogfight manually... not an option I am afraid, all the enemy jets are way faster than you and will destroy the target before you can close the gap to the objective.  TL:DR	In short... Bargain bin. If you are lucky you will avoid the technical issues, but still be hit with annoyance and contrivance. Wait for a sale or play Just Cause 2

												Its a poorly made game with lots of loading screens and jumpy cutscenes. Pretty much this game is a dumbed down Just Cause 2. No challange at all, tons of health, ammo and no quick-time events when stealing things like attack heli-copters and tanks. Nothing happens when you kill civs, nobody cares that you just blew up a gas station full of people. Its games like this that ruin the memories of a good game. I wouldn't expect people to be able to play this game without hardware close to what I own.  The FPS seems to be locked at 60 and constantly drops down to around 20 while driving through fields and such, but stays at 60 while in combat. I am already bored of this game. You can easily take over the whole island in an hour if you dedicated, there does not seem to really be any threat in this game. Even on hard I feel like I'm just punching a bunch of legless children.Oh and don't get me started on the stupid leaderboard thats not only broken but stupid as ♥♥♥♥.I guess there is only a few of us that can even *play* the game, but it shouldn't be this easy to just destroy the leaderboard. I am tired of seeing "♥♥♥♥♥♥has beat your score in donkey punching" Its just more annoying than anything else. Posted: March 9, 2016
												CONS- you can't just enter a vehicle by pressing the interaction button, while within a specific radius of the vehicle, like in GTA, you have to look directly at the vehicle's door to enter it, which makes it difficult to escape a firefight before the vehicle starts burning/ gets destroyed (especially annoying when you found a rare vehicle, like a good chopper/ jet)- car handling is the worst- bike handling is even worse- plane handling sucks as hell- takes forever to login, especially when i can't login for some reason, it tries to, every f***ing time, that I pause the game,    which takes forever- game won't keep my keybindings, resets them everytime that I restart the game- bike/car handling is even worse when using a controller- vehicle physics suck as hell (you hit the curb with high speed then your car jumps 8ft in the air and performs a 180)- buttons to use your plane's rudder are 'x' and 'b', not 'rb' and 'lb' (xbox 360 cntroller) like in GTA V, for example, which doesn't make any sense at all and you can't change them- key to use nitro in planes is the same as the one to increase thrust (means that I have to release that key in order to let the nitro refill, which means that I'm slowing down, which sucks in plane races)- don't expect a vehicle handling like in GTA V... in Just Cause 3 it just feels like a massive input lag... whenever you are driving fast and you tip your 'a' or 'd' key, your car/bike doesn't react at all... but whenever you hold your 'a' or 'd' key, your car/bike starts turning like hell- grappling hook range is too low (especially when using a parachute/ wingsuit)- game used to stop detecting my keyboard whenever i changed my key settings after starting the game (I was unable to do anything, had to end the game)... SEEMS TO BE FIXED- key bindings system is annonying as f***, because some actions share the same key, e.g. reloading your weapon on the bike and firing the secondary weapon in your plane/chopper- you can't run- you can't go directly out of wingsuit mode, you have to open your parachute first, in order to land... I WAS WRONG...YOU CAN.. YOU JUST HAVE TO UNLOCK THIS ABILITY- have you ever tried to drive a truck or bus? you have to constantly hold you 'a' or 'd' key for a couple of seconds to turn your wheels, which makes its almost impossible to effectively use those vehiclesPROS- map is huge- game is fun (as long as you don't HAVE to use vehicles, as in races)(don't know if the following arguments are PROS)- boat handling is ok- chopper handling is okEven though there are many CONS, the game still is a lot of fun!But I hope that the negative reviews might get the developers' attention and cause them to fix some points.

												First of all this game is amazing. So much fun to play. I played JC2 and it was a load of fun and now this takes the cake.Well worth the money allthough I would say try 3rd party sites to get this game. On greenmangaming I paid $30 to get this game so its been so worth it. I can say that in 30 hours my game has never crashed, I have had no graphics issues, no memory leaks, and can play the game maxed out at 60+ fps. However there are some issues.PROS+Cool wingsuit+EXPLOSIONS!!!+Ammo crates for full refill+Detachable mini gun+Good variety of vechs+Challanges are fun+Supply drops are better here in JC3 then in JC2 but buggy (see cons)+Anything can be destroyed+Cool new tether system means you can be playing with physics for hours+Rebel assistance and they drive for you - but buggy (see cons)+Meele is good addition but rarely used+Racing a ghost in challanges is really coolCONS (There is a lot but still a good game)+Cars are pretty hard to drive - they're slow and turn slowly at slow speeds and too much at fast speeds and the brake is useless+Hard to aim accurately - crosshair is hard to see with oversized grapple marker in the way and auto aim seems to work sometimes but not others+No fine precise movement means its hard to get a msg context or to use an item +Getting in vechs are a little hard when in a rush - you have to be like facing the drivers door or no go+Helicopters and tank turrets are slow to turn as in you have to row your mouse across the desk like 20 times just to turn 180+Aiming crosshair is off for tank turrets and the big corvette ship+Most boats aren't still even when you are they float around and start turning randomly making it hard to shoot +No unique buildings to explode like in JC2. Its the same 15 models over and over+Sometimes the heat is hard to remove even with 1 star - they see you a mile away or make a call for reinforcements in like .5 sec+The constant leaderboard stuff is really annoying and would like to see an option for it to be removed +Supply drop destroys my ordered helicopter every single time (even on flat ground) - I have stopped using it +No way to turn off wingsuit and just free fall to ground - you must deploy parachute+Rebels can ride in your vech (Never works) - Drive up and honk and most of the time the rebels just stand their gawking at you, only rarely do they actually hop in you vechicleEDIT: Some computer specs:-i7-8GB of RAM-Game runs on 1 TB SSD-GTX 780-Win 10 64 bit-Playing in 1360x768

												First of all this game is amazing. So much fun to play. I played JC2 and it was a load of fun and now this takes the cake.Well worth the money allthough I would say try 3rd party sites to get this game. Its the same 15 models over and over+Sometimes the heat is hard to remove even with 1 star - they see you a mile away or make a call for reinforcements in like .5 sec+The constant leaderboard stuff is really annoying and would like to see an option for it to be removed +Supply drop destroys my ordered helicopter every single time (even on flat ground) - I have stopped using it +No way to turn off wingsuit and just free fall to ground - you must deploy parachute+Rebels can ride in your vech (Never works) - Drive up and honk and most of the time the rebels just stand their gawking at you, only rarely do they actually hop in you vechicleEDIT: Some computer specs:-i7-8GB of RAM-Game runs on 1 TB SSD-GTX 780-Win 10 64 bit-Playing in 1360x768

Posted: December 11, 2015
Let's face it: the game is badly optimized. With my quite good build, I ram like crazy unless I turn everything down. So basically, I play on low-medium settings so that I don't experience framerate issues, but even then I get sometimes some drops.EDIT:Since the recent patch it's much better, as I can run it in full-medium settings (and 1080p) without any framerate issue, so that's a big plus.Now let's review itI'll do my usual thing, a pros and cons list.Pros1) The game, even if I play on low settings, looks good. It's colorful, bright, smooth, and the explosions are incredibly enjoyable2) The sounds are ok, and the voice actors (for the french version at least) are really funny and well done.3) I liked the musics, even though they are quiet and you don't really hear them.4) The gameplay is fun and addictive. I love the wingsuit, I enjoy moving through the mountains with my gears, the shooting is fun. Though I had to remap a bit my controls because I wanted it to feel like Just Cause 2, it plays well, and it is fun.5) The explosions and the grappling hook... Nothing else to say, it's just well done. The game become somewhat a physics-based game with the ability to use your grappling.6) Huge map, a lot of places to blow up.7) I don't have any problem with this leaderboard thing, I find it fine and a good thing, to compare yourself with other people.Cons1) You won't give a crap about the story, as for Just Cause 2.2) The map is too big. Yes, I said it was a pro, but my main problem is when you try to go from an island to the other. If you don't have a jet, it'll take forever to crosse the water.3) I still don't get how the chaos work for this episode - might change this point once I figure it out.4) As stated above, the optimization, it's still not great, but they are working on it.ConclusionOverall, this game is a fun experience, if you like blowing things up and killing people like there is no tomorrow (which is my case so...). If you want deep story, dark intrigue, multiplayer mode or realistic gunfight, just ignore this game. I think that if you liked Just Cause 2, you'll like this one too. It's not perfect, it surely isn't as good as JC2, but it's fun, and it gives you explosion, so it's nice.BEFORE ANYONE ASK FOR MY CONFIG:Intel Core i7 4970k quadcore 3.6GHz16Go DDR3 RAMNvidia GTX960 with 2Go GDDR5And I run on Windows 10

												JC2 vs JC3...In JC2, the military bases were so incredibly similar, that not one base was memorable. Every base take over became a test to see how fast I could complete yet another base take down.In JC3, base take overs seem a little different. The bases and cities are built on mountain terrain, which makes most bases seem unique. But now I have gotten to an area which seems to always have a base built into a giant hole in the ground.JC3 has enough challenges after taking down a base, that it mixes up the monotony. But some of these challenges became so mundane and hard, that you will find yourself choosing the F1 race car (DUO) on the first attempt. Or the wingsuit challenges you can get 5 stars (gears) on the first try, cause you are so good at it.The most fun challenge is over-coming your friend's scores, since they are human. Plus your friend's ghost can be fun to race against. -----Multiplayer is a mod.Currently, nothing spawns in the world automatically.But you can spawn many vehicles and guns. You have most of the unlocks already unlocked on you, even jetpacks!You can't tether two items together.You can type "t" then "/tp volcano" to tp to the volcano. Similar for a few other locations, like statue.You can destroy bridges.You can kill each other. A player respawns where they died, with 5 seconds spawn protection.We raced around the island on the train track, after flying planes into each other and running each other over. content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
												There are few games I've really wanted to love as much as Just Cause 3, and even fewer that are as hard to love.Just Cause 3 is one of those kind of games in which the developer has absolutely no idea as to why the original game was popular, similar to Saints Row 3 for instance. What it leads to is a lot of changes no one wants that somehow makes it a massively worse game overall. Avalanche handing the game off to their New York based studio as opposed to doing it themselves is likely playing no small part in that.The game immediately starts off with a scripted sequence in which you stand around on a plane doing... A whole lot of nothing. This in itself sets the tone for all of the missions ahead pretty well. They can all be amounted to one of two tasks; you either have to protect something/someone, or you have to destroy something. It gets incredibly stale incredibly fast, and with them adding a lot of scripted elements into the mix for these too; it also becomes really unfun.Now if you thought just the game part of the missions was bad enough, you thought wrong, because there's still the atrociously bad story to take into account too. All the writing is just plain not funny or engaging in the slightest, and I think Mario might be one of the most obnoxiously written characters I've yet to encounter in a video game. He is the closest I've seen a video game come to making it's very own Jar-Jar Binks. Constantly in your face since the developers were oh so certain you would love him, and constantly incredibly unfunny. Thankfully, at least the developers themselves must have realized how awful their writing is, because they did have the decency to make it incredibly easy to just skip all cutscenes.That's enough for just the missions, as for the rest of the game and more specifically the gameplay it's something of a mixed but mostly bad bag. I will begin by saying that I really enjoy using the wingsuit to move around, it was a needed addition that does the game well. If the wingsuit itself was the welcome addition to the game, then the gear mod upgrade system is most definitely the unwelcome one. In an attempt to copy a lot of other modern games, they added a system for upgrading your tools to get a lot of basic abilities. All it leads to is removing the sense of freedom that Just Cause 2 had, in which you were always capable of doing everything at any given point.  Rico himself feels like he controls a bit more heavily, and the camera tends to be just a lot too zoomed in, too. All in all, the gameplay just completely lacks the freedom which Just Cause 2 had. Which is, again, an example of the developers completely failing to understand anything about what made it good.On first glance, the map and the activities around it seem a lot more interesting, but soon you realize there's not actually a whole lot to them. They are all pretty same-y and quickly stop being fun. Activities almost all amount to you needing to fly/drive through rings or destroy some stuff. Probably the only creative ones are the ones for upgrading the tether, in which you use the tether to attach a ball to your car then drive it around collecting rocks. Yet the gear mod system I mentioned earlier is directly tied to them and how you do in them, so you have no choice but to continue doing them in order to get the most out of your various gadgets. These activities are also how they try to compensate for the much, much smaller map than that of Just Cause 2, but with how monotone they quickly get it just does not work at all. The settlements themselves are a bit more fleshed out than those of Just Cause 2, but the amount of fleshing out does in no way compensate for just how much less content there is.Oh and on a quick footnote, the PC port itself is absolutely horrendous as well. Terrible performance on systems that should run it just fine, and memory leak issues causing frequent crashes. It's an absolute joke of a PC port and it makes me sick that it's been out this long without them having done much to fix it.In conclusion, or a tl;dr for those not interested in this wall of text. Just Cause 3 is an incredibly disappointing game both as a sequel to Just Cause 2 and as a game of its own. It does very little right, and very much wrong. I can't possibly recommend it to anyone at all, even less at the price they are currently asking for it. It's just not even remotely worth it.

												As I write this review I currently have played 53 hours over the past week since launch, and I believe this is enough time to make an accurate review. First off I would like to say that it is a great game and despite the many performance and technical issues people are having I believe it is a really good game. I myself have no had any issues to speak of besides the occasional crash, which is to be expected in a game less than a week old. In my setup currently I have an R9 290x with the latest drivers an FX 8350 and 16gb of ram. I run this game maxed out and get 60fps most of the time except during explosions which I believe is due to my CPU. When buying this game I had hoped for a game that was similar to Just Cause 2 but just had more features and was overall a better more polished game. It did not disappoint, the addition of the wingsuit is enough for me to want to buy the game. Nothing beats soaring through the skies or gliding across the ground in a wingsuit.  This game brings all the great things that we all loved from Just Cause 2 and more, I cannot reccommend it enough.  Although the story may not be great, for me the game isn't about the story I play it for the free roam and base liberation, the story to me is more or less just a side mission. Overall this is a great game and has many amazing features that solidify this game as my favourite game of the year even taking top spot over the Witcher 3: WIld Hunt. Even though many people have had performance issues my game runs as smooth as butter. All in all a fantastic game. I reccomend.

Posted: December 11, 2015
												JC3 basically takes the same formula from JC2 and turns it up several notches. The wingsuit is an absolute treat to fly around in and the new grapple mechanics give you an incredible toolkit for destruction. However, several of the notches are undoubtly placed backwards. Vehicle handling is questionable at times; you can hit a pebble and spin wildly out of control (this is even with a controller). Motorcycles are terrible compare to their counterparts in the previous game and are not worth using at all. Medici is a vast and gorgeous place but portions of it are completely devoid of content. For example, the entire upper half of the largest island is nothing more than scattered villages and outposts.There's no awe inspiring capital city to speak of and a complete lack of more interesting and unique locales like the previous title. The game tries to pass it off as part of the backstory but it honestly feels more like a rush job. Unfortunately the game is also riddled with constant crashes and memory leaks. Hopefully these get resolved in due time. Recommended but with some reservation. There are some performance problems and some questionable design changes but they don't dampen the core gameplay that is Just Cause. Blowing stuff up and creating chaos in a sandbox is still some good, chaotic fun.

Posted: December 7, 2015
												I Really wanted to love this. Since the first trailer I was overwhelmed with hype, however, here it is.Ill start by saying, this game is beautiful, graphically speaking.Again, HOWEVER, the pc port is porely optimised, and I was getting huge frame drops, on a  GTX 970.Though the wingsuit is a GREAT feature, I found myself getting bored, as the story missions are locked behind repetitive liberations, where you blow♥♥♥♥♥♥up. BLOWING♥♥♥♥♥♥UP IS GREAT, especially in a game about blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up, you'd expect it to be. sigh, HOWEVER, the novelty of blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up quickly wears off, and the story becomes increasingly stale.It lacks an FOV slider. cmon, guys, there is also no ability to remap gamepad controls. wtf?I decided to go for keyboard+mouse, and remap the controls to jc2's. big mistake. for the controls to properly function you need to dive into the games files, and remap them there, otherwise there is overlap, that can't be changed. (I'm looking at you, "F" key.)This game has, without a doubt, the prettiest explosions, and prettiest world, in pc gaming for this year. (excluding GTA V), props to avalanche for that.Aiming in requires an unlock. And spriting is gone aswell, I'm going to overlook this, as the game has a lot of controls, and it is supposed to be a console game, at heart, but seriously.Like i mentioned at the start, I REALLY WANTED TO LOVE THIS, but it's fallen flat on its face, compared to Just Cause 2. 5/10. perhaps a patch can solve a few of the issues, performance wise, if so, ill bump it up to a 6. Verdict: Buy it, play it for a bit, see if you like it, if not, refund it, like I unfortunately did. Have Fun.

content:
Posted: January 18, 2016
												TL;DR: I really like this game for it's simple yet satisfying gameplay and pretty colors.This is a very fun game. The game is based around the grappling hook, wing suit and parachute, and these mechanics alone allowed me to sink hours into it. Just flying around is very satisfying and relaxing. The gameplay apart from that is crazy, you blow stuff up in different locations, which pretty much describes the entire game and its plot. The game doesn't take itself serious (only briefly in the end for some reason), and that's what I like about it. It's just one big pile of explosions and flying around.There's also cool challenges that you can complete around the world. What I liked about these are that they integrate with the massive open world nicely and smoothly. Speaking of the world, it's beautiful and colorful.The game is not too challenging to complete, although it gets harder when you progress in the story (or by liberating more settlements?). Only when I tried to liberate the central commands had I any chance of dying.In my eyes the game is perfectly enjoyable, except for a few issues: The game tries to promote the use of vehicles a lot, but there's no reason to use them as flying around is faster and more flexible. I only ever stole jets for blowing up bases more easily. The other more serious flaw with the game is the framerate. I have a decent setup (120 fps in GTA V), but for whatever reason the fps never really reached 60. At times the fps looked like it was capped at 30 too, and dropped frequently during that period. The game could do with some optimization in that aspect.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												Another great game from Avalanche Studios that can make even Michael Bay feel jealous!This time the action takes place in Medici, an archipelago with a mediterranean look where everything seems to be latinized. The voice acting of most characters is done with an italian accent and sometimes they sound funny. Even the PSAs that you hear on the radio after liberating a base are hilarious.The game doesn't take itself too seriously. Story is generic, just as expected, but you are here for the action and to blow stuff up - and that is where the game shines. Explosions look awesome with nice particle effects and Rico Rodriguez, the one-man-army, has a lot of creative ways to make things go BOOM. You can use a wide variety of guns and vehicles, but some of your best and most fun toys unlock later in the game. The open-world is filled with optional activities and collectibles, but there is some grinding involved if you want to unlock all the mods. Although the open-world is huge, there are a lot of useless green areas like forests or fields that make for long travelling times between objectives (until fast travel is unlocked). Unfortunately the game is not very well optimized for PC and the physics engine acts unexpected sometimes. If you are hoping for another Mad Max then you'll be disapointed because this game requires a high-end machine to run smooth. There is an always-online component that makes the game stutter. Also, found one game breaking bug in a main story mission so I would suggest to wait for further patches that will hopefully improve optimisation and fix all issues.Overall: I had a fun time with Just Cause 3 and I recommend it if you like open-world action games. Viva Medici!

content:
Posted: December 9, 2015
												Much as I loved this game when I first started playing it (got 45hrs on it at the time of writing), I have to say my enthusiasm's starting to wane a bit now due to some of the glitches and design decisions. That said, hopefully the patch, when it comes, will address some of these...1) If you're used to the parachute controls in JC2 and the JC2MP mod, you're going to find the parachute handles very differently in JC3. Whilst it feels a lot more realistic, it's a lot slower and less responsive in its handling in JC3, so I find myself having to crunk my way around, which is tedious by comparison to JC2's parachute handling. I know there's a wingsuit, but try flying very tight turns between city buildings in the wingsuit and staying aloft.2) The land vehicle handling has been commented on by other posters - slow to start turning, then turns very sharply. I know JC2's vehicles had very sensitive handling, but at least it was fairly linear, so you could get used to the sensitivity after a while. The overall handling in JC3 is also less responsive, less fun as far as I can see.3) The failure to respond to control input which dogged JC2 and the MP mod is still apparent in JC3. Some of it is because Rico's busy doing something else with his hands (reloading, etc), but I've had plenty of times where Rico's just completely ignored the first two or three button presses while doing absolutely nothing else. The worst instance is when trying to place C4 on the underside of a chopper that's airborne - on one occasion, I had to hit the mouse button about 10 times to get him to finally place the explosive.4) Some of the missions are really quite badly put together. Again, maybe a patch would add a bit of polish, but as one example, having to push one of the NPCs 25 metres to persuade them to get onto a chopper so the mission could end isn't hugely impressive.On the plus side:a) Even on my crusty rig (i5-750, GTX 750Ti, 8GB RAM and an SSD), the game looks pretty good with some of the settings turned down, and it runs well in terms of frame-rate (though there are occasional slowdowns and the odd crash to desktop).b) The wingsuit has a steep learning curve, and the handling still needs work IMO, but it's a lot of fun :-)c) There's a good choice of weapons, and the tanks are great for shooting up bases from nearby hillsides without even being detected :-)I like JC3 a lot, and I'm optimistic the patch might help improve things further, but after more than 400hrs on JC2, and more than 900hrs on JC2MP, I still think it could have been better.

												Really, it's a disappointment.Nothing awful. It isn't eye-schorchingly bad, it isn't going to offend you, but it also just isn't fun. Avalanch Studios found a way to make blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up not fun.See, in Just Cause 2, this wasn't a problem. The game was a lot more open, and bases were smaller and designed better. If it was red, you were supposed to shoot it, and it would explode. Do this abot 5 times, and the base was liberated. Add in some combat as a natural obstacle and make traversal generally fun, and you've got a good little set up. Everything in Just Cause 2 just worked.Just Cause 3 is a different story entirely. Vehicles are sluggish, the wingsuit is thrilling at first but you'll tire of it quickly. The combat is fine, nothing more, nothing less. The base liberation is outright boring as hell. You have a laundry list of small doodads you have to destroy, and the base isn't liberated until you've gotten them all. This wasn't a problem in JC2 with the crates you had to collect, because it had indicators and a minimap. Here? No such luck. If you want to know where stuff is, you need to open the menu which just trashes the pacing. Destroy a thing, check the map. Walk across town and have some boring combat. Destroy a thing. Check the map. Finally, you finish off the town by flying over the walls of a base, pressing two buttons, then going to the center of town and pressing another button to raise the flag. Repeat with slight variations (like in the powerplant, where it adds time limits to press the buttons for added pain) for every base so far.This really stings because the game has a lot of good stuff in it! The combat is close to being good, I love what you can do with the wires now, the graphics are just gorgeous and so is Medichi. With another year in development, this would have blown Just Cause 2 out of the water. Sadly, it's a bunch of super cool mechanics (and a few not-quite-finished ones, like the driving, the combat) floating in an awful framework. I couldn't even make my own fun. My helicoptor raids ended in me getting quickly shot down by the F-YOU SAM sights, and my planned assault on a city with a tank ended with the tank bugging out of existance and me rage-quitting.Oh, bad PC port too. Not terrible, just bad. You can't re-bind F without it still doing something else, it doesn't like to be in fullscreen, and you literally can't skip the opening FOV with the company logos unless you have a controller. This might be a good game to play with the Steam Controller honestly.Hey, maybe it gets better. Maybe the missions later are really good, or the chalenges that I didn't try were fun, or something. But the fact that I have literally no desire to keep playing the sequel to just cause 2 says a lot. Give it a miss, play JC2 instead.

content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
												Fortuntely for me, it seems I dodged the bullet and I have been able to run the game at max settings without any issues that some players are experiencing.System Specs CPU: Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4790K Processor @ 4.40GHz CPU Cooler: Corsair H100i GPU: GeForce GTX 970 G1 Gaming Memory: Corsair Vengeance 16GBNow, onto the game itself. If you have played any previous entries in the Just Cause Series, you will be immediately familiar with the gameplay. Rico makes his usual "subtle" arrival to the country of Medici, which has a Mediterranean theme to it. As usual, there is a dictator to be deposed, and in order to do so Rico (you) must loosen the dictator's grip on the land by causing as much chaos as possible.For those new to the series, causing chaos is essentially destroying the dictator's assets by any means necessary, so shooting up Fuel Tanks, driving cars into Power Generators, and pretty much just wrecking everything however you see fit. Some new mechanics are in place for those familiar with the series, but a few new additions change things up for the better.Your grappling hook gets a few snazzy upgrades right off the bat, such as being able to manually "reel in" tethered objects allowing you to winch items, as well as the usual making the dictator's forces just "hand around". Another upgrade is that you can now have more than one "pair" of teathered objects.Something new to the series is that challenges are now required to upgrade various things, with relevant challenges tied to each upgrade. For example, Explosive Challenges upgrade your explosives, Air Vehicle Challenges have air vehicle upgrades, etc. The upgrades range from new gadgets to cause chaos, to improved ammo storage, and even things like nitrous for vehicles. The grapple also has upgrades, so that the "reel in" is stronger for when you want to topple a statue quietly, or even one where you can have even more teathers for making some interesting combinations.Another change up to the series is that you can secure areas as you go along by clearing out all of the dictator's assets in a specific region. Doing so unlocks various challenges (to earn those upgrades), as well as a few other perks. Hidden Packages are still present, and if you clear out an area the locations are revealed if you do not want to search every nook and cranny beforehand. Some of those hidden packages range from parts to collect, to backstory tapes, and the like. Liberating a settlement also can unlock new items to call in, as well as open up a garage to bring vehicles that you can then call in later. For example, that sweet motorcycle you found can be turned in to make it available anywhere, and you can turn in aircraft, cars, and even boats!Overall, the game does not try to take itself seriously, which is never really has. While it has its "serious" moments, the characters are usually over the top, and a one liner is usually not too far behind any major plot points/discussions. While some might find it to be groan worthy (as a Dad, we're talking like dad caliber jokes here at times), there are some clever gems here and there. My only real gripe here is that the voice actors from 2 are somewhat missed here, but the current ones are growing on me, so perhaps that is a good thing.So, I would recommend this game if you are into a game where over the top action gameplay is your cup of tea. There are plenty of ways to cause chaos, and the world is quite large so you won't be running out of things to do anytime soon. Of course, I understand that some people are having issues with performance, but at this time I was not one of them, so I cannot comment negatively about something I never experienced. Like I said in my opening statement, I am running the game at max settings and I have not had any problems yet with crashes or slowdowns.

It's a map of islands after allhttp://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/89345971223120666/8BB51024A866A33B4726A0E3CD0CAE1AC7D0D400/And here is the stuck reinforcement iconhttp://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/89345971223126252/91454B50A2379B162F90504ED8BFA0D0D445A001/Lastly, I have my experience CONSTANTLY interrupted by server disconnects. It's a single player game so that's obviously frustrating. You can choose "offline mode" but as if to add insult to injury, the game will periodically FORCE attempts to reconnect! I don't give a crap about JohnnyNobody who beat all my feats 4hrs ago ... when I choose "offline mode" it should do/be what it says ...Opened my map? Better check online stats  Popped my chute to climb? Better try to check online stats  Got a lucky headshot from a long way away? You better be damn sure it wants to check online statsAny other of a few dozens triggers? Better check stats!NOT ONLINE? FORCE THE RECONNECT, OBVIOUSLY! And what happens when it fails to reconnect? You have to choose "offline mode" again and start this cycle over. Really, really breaking my experience with this game

content:
Posted: December 1, 2015
												My impression is good so far, I'm having a lot of fun and I'm looking forward to spending lots of time messing around. If you buy this game expecting a deep and introspective work of art, look elsewhere. If you buy it and are looking for a fun game to experiment with and show your friends, this is the game for you.Pros:- Beautiful graphics and map design (love the vivid colors, lush landscapes and the sea is gorgeous.)- Very fun gameplay (explosions, flying, and killing, oh my)- Lots to work towards if you are a completionist- Non-linear so you can progress past the missions or ignore them altogether after a point- Lots of Easter Eggs- Civilian cars can be captured and then ordered via black market supply drops- Lots of models of cars, planes, tanks, and weapons to use- Super corny voice-acting (JC staple)- Sound effects are high quality- Visual effects are stunning- The new Wingsuit navigates really smoothly and is very fun once you get the hang of itCons:- Occasional bugs (nothing game-breaking for me as of yet, but I've had to restart a few missions due to bugged objectives)- Physics are wonky as hell (can be a pro in some cases, it's more geared towards fun than realism but mostly proves clunky and strange)- Driving has some of the worst physics I've come across in any game (motorcycles are nearly impossible to drive)- Moving rico around can be a hassle and interacting with vehicles or items can be a pain- Not much depth story or character wise, but this is to be expected- Always online can prove to be a nuisance if your connection is spotty (constant reconnection attempts)All in all I am happy with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone considering it who knows what they are in for in a Just Cause game. I will update this review as I put in more hours.Specs:- i7-6600k- 16 gb ram- Nvidia 980ti G1 Gaming- Windows 10 - 7200 rpm HD- 1080p monitorPerformance:- Stable fps  75 all maxed @ 1080p- Load times take around 10 secs

												DO NOT BUYThe game is designed to be always online. If you cannot connect to the servers you will have wait for about 10-20 seconds on a connecting screen then be asked if you want to retry or go offline. Once you go offline, every few minutes when you enter a menu it will try and reconnect, forcing you to sit there for 10-20 seconds while it tries to connect.I haven't had many technical problems with the game except for a few annoying crashes on the map screen but hopefully those will be ironed out.The game itself isn't too bad, it's basically Just Cause 2 but with some new weapons, gadgets and vehicles on a new map. The controls for mouse and keyboard aren't too bad for the most part, vehicles feel a bit clunky and I've had some issues rebinding controls but other than that mouse and keyboard seem ok.If you really want to pay £40 for practically more of the same but with bugs and unbearable 'always online' features then go ahead but if not, wait for them to remove the annoying reconnection issues and get it on a steam sale.

												Cannot play oflfine, forced DRM is a real ♥♥♥♥♥.  I tried to run this game behind a firewall (I have a portable computer that I can update at home just for this reason).   This game will not launch without an active dial home... So even if you are online, but games are filted by a firewall, forget it.   I was on the fence about recomended this game or not, that DRM kills it. Pro:ExplosionsFlyingGrappeling things to things - You cannot have more fun than hanging enimies in a jeep from a cave roof. grappling a helicopter to a huge rockCons:Limited varity - every town liberation is the same basic thing.No reall stand out locations.   There is some varity of terrain, but nothing to say you are in X city or Y port.  Each city and port could be swapped out and no one would  notice.No challange - Rico is a god among men, with a pistol and using none of his other abilties he can take on an army.  Add in the grappler, wing suit and drops, the enemy should be giving up.   I tend to die most often from SAM sites respawning or de hacking themselves more than the actual AI.   In fact the time I am most at risk is trying to take a helicopter, as for some reasons SAM's aim at you while hanging outside of one too.Unlimited flying - Seriously between the parachute and the wingsuit you never have to touch the ground.  it is faster than a car, and always availbe... outside of long trips over the ocean all vehicles in this game are just toys with no purpose.TL:DR - If you truly enjoyed the random explosions and chaos of JC2, this game is worth a look (I'd wait for a sale).   If you want anyting at all more than that, keep playing JC2, this game is a mild upgrade to it.

												Wow, when I saw the announcement trailer for this game I did not really think much of it.But now, I've played it, I LOVE IT!Just Cause 3 is a game about the island of Medici that is being overruled by a tyrant and dictator named Di Ravello who is harvesting the element Bavarium to control the island, you and the rebel alliance try to over throw Di Ravello and capture Medici.You may be thinking, so what? content:
Posted: December 3, 2015
												So, i've been waiting years for this game to come out. I was a huge fan of JC2 and went all in on JC3. JC2 did a lot of things well, and JC3 looked to build off of that. But there are definetly issues, and I would not recommend this game to anyone until they are addressed. 1. The game takes forever and a day to start. and THEN it has to "login", which also takes forever. I clocked it at 1min30S to get to the ACTUAL menu that lets you start the game. 2. they want you to submit support issues to a terribly designed, unusuable support portal. what a joke. I'm happy to communicate issues instead of write a bad review, but their support portal is truly terrible and is more a hommage to support, like its an obligation, than a portal that is serious about fielding support and feedback. Needlessly beurocratic and specific, when all you should be giving me is a big textbox. That raises questions for me about how serious they are about making this a great game and listening to user feedback; because it's the same kinda♥♥♥♥♥♥you'd expect from EA.3. Its 'E'  to get into a vehicle, but good luck figuring out how to get out of a vehicle. maybe it's apce? maybe it's W, or A? one of them seems to do it eventually, but it's not at all what i would normally expect or do. 4. the tutorial system, meant to clarify how to use the game, manages to be confusing. JC2 had one too, but it was a good one. It's unconnected from what you need to do, not clear, and more annoyance than helpful. really really wish this was better, because they've done better in the past; which makes it so frustrating. I don't know how you could create this and use this and think its overall a good idea. 5. can't `esc` to exit map. MUST hit tab again. boo. can't 'esc' to exit menu, have to hit...CTRL??? who designes this nonsense?6. 'F' used to be grapple in JC2, now is explosives. have made that mistakemany many times. Perhaps more an annoying learning curve, but equally its annoying that keybindings would change so much between versions; makes going between JC2/JC3 painful. But, its not like the change is illogical; grappling is now considered a primary action, in place of the weapon switch. 7. GET RID OF THE SOCIAL. I want MULTIPLAYER not some nonsense leaderboard against people I don't know or care about. If I can't play with my friends, it's a single player game. Who thought this was a good idea? Really? because they should be fired. 8. No way to start the game in offline mode, or skip login, or anything. i never want to be online with this game! If/once the above issues are fixed, I can recommend the game, because it is otherwise a good game. They focused on fun and not restrictions, and it shows. There's lots to love, to be honest. But, the above issues are not nothing, sans #6. They improved the drops so you can airdrop a few things, which I definetly wanted in JC2. So, they aren't just making a JC3 to milk the fanbase, but they are going to need to release fixes and patches to make this game better than JC2. Which, it can be, if they address the issues. If/when they do, I will update my review/recommendation.

Posted: December 19, 2015
												Lets start off by saying that I am NOT going to compare this game to JC2. In my opinion, this is an entirely different game. Of course it has elements from JC2 but I like to believe that the developers wanted to give a completely different angle. JC2 was awesome but in my opinion, JC3 is too.The environment is absolutely incredible. It gives a real feeling of being in a Mediterranean country and I have been playing this game for around 25 hours now, and haven't even been to ~3/4th of the map.The vehicle system is a lot of fun. The fact that you can bring cars, motorcycles, boat and even freaking planes to a garage so that you can drop them anytime you want is awesome. I have to agree that the handling of some vehicles can be troublesome, but it makes me love the variety in vehicles even more.Some say the hate the fact that there is no sprinting, no crouching etc. Forget about that. The possibilities are endless with the amazing upgraded grappling hook you get right from the start. And lets not forget that you can use a two handed weapon from the sky with your parachute and pull yourself towards enemies to stomp their faces in. No need for crouching or sprinting.The detail, on almost every part of the game, is extreme. For example, I was driving an F1 and a small rock hit my front axle, what made the front wheels shiver a bit. You may call this stuff a pre in a game, but I can see a lot of effort went into it in this game.Did I mention a modding system INSIDE the game? You can complete challenges to get gears and with gears you can upgrade everything. Literally everything: Plane, Car, Boat, Weapons, Grenades and even your grappling hook. You hate repeating races, destruction etc? Not with this feature ill tell you that.Now the last part I am going to discuss are the graphics. Which are of course, amazing. I know there have been some optimization issues, but if you meet the minimal requirements you will most likely be able to run the game fine. I use a GTX 780 combined with an FX-8320 AMD processor and 16gis of ram, and I run the game on max, max and max without any optimization issues. If you are worrier about all the loading times everyone has been complaining about, it was fixed last patch.So if you are actually still reading this right now, whats the matter? Just ignore the freaking 64% positive reviews and buy the game to find out for yourself!

												I don't know where to start. I've been waiting for this game since it was announced and was happy to purchase the game with no problems. This is where the trouble begins. Let me preface this by stating my system specs, and I've tried this game with multi GPU setups as follows:Intel Core i7 2600k @5.0 Ghz8Gb DDR3 RamMSI R9 380 in CrossfireWindows 102nd test system:Intel Core i7 2600k8Gb DDR3 EVGA GTX 970 SSCWindows 10So upon release and unlocking the everything went smoothly if you can get over the fact that it has DRM up the wazoo and it asks you to sign up your email for an account, the typical 2015 move game devs do. All of that aside the menus and everything were smooth and jumping in the game was a breeze. My first setup with settings on High to very high results were terrible. Frame stuttering, frame rate drops like crazy and everything was just unplayable. Let alone the frame rate issues but there were bugs and part of the map were invisible and didnt load. I installed the "beta" drivers everyone seems to be doing but with no results. The AMD beta drivers have done nothing and pretty much gave me the same results. The game DOES NOT use crossfire so I disabled that and got the same crap resutls. It was time to move onto the Nvidia system.Jumping on the nvidia system and playing the game proved that this game was incomplete and broken. I was getting higher frame rates but everytime I shot, got shot at, or blew something up there was huge frame drops. This affirmed my decision to refund the game after about 20 minutes of play time and fiddling around with graphics settings, details, driver updates and so on. Avalanche really messed this release up and it looks like hard working customers are punished yet again. Don't buy this game until its fixed and honestly its not even worht pirating. Dont give these people your money and put it towards an indie developer who really cares about a game. Buy Rocket League, give Psyonix your money and not these plebs over at Avalnache and Square. Terrible, buggy, and shoddy release.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2015
												I cannot reccomend this game.  I wish I could.  I want to . . .Yet it is clear that while prettier than Just Cause 2, this is really a major setback, in lots of ways.From the much smaller map to the lack of compelling things to do, to the horrible voice acting . . .First off, the acting really bothered me.  Never mind that our intrepid hero looks less like Tony Montana in Scarface and more like Nathan Drake in the Uncharted games, they seem to have found a different voice actor that for whatever reason can't seem to hit on Rico's vibe.  The voice acting is so terrible and flat that one cannot say "it's so bad it's laughable" because it isn't.  It is just horrid. It sounds tired and worn out, the one-liners stilted and about as light as a helicopter with a missing rotor.   You to will be if you go through the motions in this lifeless game.I am not going to comment on the memory leaks or the stutters or even the flickering textures.  Plenty has been said of that elsewhere.  What I will comment on is how lazy the writers got with this game, or how poorly Avalanche seems to remember who Rico was from the first two games.  My feeling was that Rico was a from Central or South America and was a graduate of the School of the Americas . . . replete with exploding cigars for Castro and brutal interogation tactics.  In the previous game he reminded me in look and sound of Al Pacino's Tony Montana, espeically at the end of the film when he yells out, with abandon, "Say hello to my L I T T L E Frriend!!!".  Now he is apparently the "Most Interesting Man Alive" and selling beer, while wearing Nathan Drake's face . . .The game feels off from the get go.   There seems to be no cover mechanic.  I think it's time he had one, you know, in this day and age.  At the very least give us the old fashioned CROUCH back.  Even worse still, Rico cannot run, Stunt Jump is gone, and his dive move is also missing, leaving the player nothing but strafe as a gunplay option, which blows.  I cannot believe that Avalanche could mess this up so bad.  Such a basic thing!  EDIT:  Recently Avalanche expressed to the community that crouching, sprinting and any sort of cover mechanic was INTENTIONALLY elminated from gunplay to "encourage" players to use Rico's Aerial Moveset.  That's like telling someone that is behind a shipping container to instead run out into the open and take the RPG to the chest because "your aerial moves are freaking cool!"  Come on!The bad acting is apparent right from the beginning, so that sorta lent to that "huh?" feeling.  And then Rico's relationship to this island feels completely off too.  He talks with such gusto about destroying the place that I actually said, out loud mind you, "what about the civilians?"Early on, other problems become apparent:  In the middle of a mission to complete the capture of a town, I recieved two different, apparently random, protection objectives, one including stealing a car . . . while I was attempting to raise the flag and capture the town.  One would think that in a main storyline mission, random missions wouldn't just pop up requiring your attention.I am not having most of the problems others have with this game, so I cannot comment on those, except there are curious texture issues and some stuttering.  Everything else looks very pretty.  It just doesn't play that way.I am so frustrated with the performance issues and the attitude of the developers that I am no longer interested in Avalanche's future projects.  Last time I get burned by a developer.When it comes back on sale, grab Just Cause 2.  It is more than worth anything that you pay for it, I just cannot say the same about 3.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2015
												It is hard to not recommend this game hence the thumbs up. The game is awesome, improvements over JC2 all over the place, but, now this is a huge BUT, it is a beta. Ok they have released it as a full game but there are still way too many little things and bugs for it to be a full game, don't get me wrong, I have maybe been luckier than some as I haven't seen any game killing bugs, such as memory leaks and severe artifacts in the graphics like what some players have said, the game runs fine, although I do have a fairly high spec system, i7-4770k(OC4.2), 32Gb RAM and a GTX980Ti, the problems I see are really obvious beta issues. For instance; after completing a section of the game a street band starts to play, I know they are a band as I can hear the music and indeed see them playing their instruments, but hold on, they are really, really good instruments because they are invisible, they much have cost a fortune. Yep they are going through the motions, playing a harmonica and I see someone playing a guitar but the instruments are just not there.I have shot someone, they are dead, I know they are dead because I shot them in the head, I even got a "Head Shot" counter. But after a few seconds, he got up and started shooting again, hell, zombies get everywhere these days.I was driving up a winding road, when there was a bit of a traffic jam, I over took, as you do, to find a bus reversing down the mountain, he crashes in to a car and knocks the car over the side, of course the car explodes, this is Just Cause after all, but then the bus then drives forward, on the wrong side of the road and just continues like that. Now I'm english so I'm used to driving on the left but I thought we were meant to drive on the right in Medici.You will also see other kamikazi type manoeuvre, in other words, although it is very funny it is quite poor AI.So as you can see, although the game is completely playable, well is for me, it is far from finished. I assume it was rushed out for the holiday period to get the sales. I fully expect some huge patches not far over the horizon.Lastly I would just like to say that even though it has some bugs, it is still very enjoyable and it is also huge, the map is absolutely massive and with lots of small expansions already coming, it really is worth getting, just maybe give it a little while for the 1st patch. Hope this helps, thats why I wrote this. Now I'm off to drive my car backwards all over town. It's the way its done on Medici after all. :)

content:
Posted: December 1, 2015
												Update:While this game has improved in playability, it is still a vast let down in the quality of content it has. The main island has almost nothing on it, the vehicles handled terribly and the menus still have controller icons on them in places.Dev's have said they'd address what the community has said - well I'll believe it when I see it.----Day of Release Review:I'll continually update this in the coming days but for now, day 1, the game is pretty below par. Why are we not allowed good day 1 releases? Where was the QA/testing? You don't sell me a car on release and then tell me the stero doesn't work until you patch it in a few days, or a toaster that will burn my toast for the next week because you couldn't work something out in the thermostat controls. Common Square Enix, I paid you $70 NZD for a game and I can't even get a stable day 1 play!Cons:- Driving, while better than JC2 still feels like you're driving a concrete block with wheels. The cars do not feel any better, sure they feel different than JC2 but not by much. This is my biggest dissapointment to be honest.- Motorbikes, they have like a .5 second delay between when you hit the key to turn and the bike starts turning - its horrible and means you overcompensant everything and spin out... just wrong.- Helicopters, from what I can tell feel okay but theres something wrong with how they move too ... maybe that concrete block just grew rotors?- Jetski, try holding the reverse key and watch yourself spin in circles! For added nausia, hold the reverse and left or right key to make yoursellf projectile vomit in all the directions. This pretty much just makes you spin really fast in circles - bloody weird.- Story, again Square Enix manages to do the whole 'throwing you into something with no backstory or character development' just take this gun, shoot those guys grapple here and drive here and meet her - sweet, heres the black market oh I mean supply drop grenade. Have fun. While Rico might know these people I certainly didn't see a familiar face from JC2 (except Sheldon). SE I thought you would learn from JC2.- Derp eyes on Rico during one of the first few cutscences when you're having supper and talking on the fence. Just saying.- FPS, oh how it hurts. VSync off and spin around - watch your frames go through the floor. Blow that building up? Heres you 0fps for 5 seconds reward! Yeah, the FPS is stable when you look forward... without any sudden movements (so forget keeping it stable during combat or driving and shooting!)Pros:- When the frames are stable, the game looks good; even on medium everything it looks really nice.- Crash models are vastly improved over JC2.- Wingsuit is fun (when you get the feel of it)- Still has that JC2 feel in a new location (huge map!) and lots of cool explosions and shooting and stuff. If you liked JC2 like I did I think you'll like this - but that damn list above the pros needs fixing ASAP.Again, I will update in a few days after some patches come out - but unless it improves on these points this review will be sticking negatory :\

												Before I write my review I would like to say this game crashed constantly for me on Windows 10, I set the compatibility mode to Vista SP2 in the .exe properties and it hasnt crashed since.This is the most fun ive had in a single player game since forever, they really made the game free and fun like a super hero game mixed with mercenaries game. The negative thing about this game is there are a few game breaking bugs that they didnt care to fix, the driving is a bit poor and there's a lot of superficial/unrealistic content. The story and writing are laughable but its a game, I don't recall many games having good stories anyways(who cares). The writing is a bit comical and I feel its better acted than what ive seen from JC2. This game really has a bad rep and I dont feel it deserves outside of bugginess. content:
Posted: January 23, 2016
 I give Just Cause 3: 6/10  SPOILER FREE! Just cause 3 is a very good game. It has many pros aswell as flaws. Just cause for me has been a great franchise, Its one of my childhood favourites. I really got into Just Cause when Just Cause 2 demo dropped in 2010, gosh I played that demo over and over again even though it was 30 minutes. Just Cause always been a game where its a sandbox full of explosions. Now let's get into the games pros and cons. Pros  The best feature is the map. The map is beautifully designed, with a range of different places to visit. Just cause 3's map from 2 isn't bigger, but it surely is more vivid and alive. The combat in the game is very good. It's really fun to blow up stuff depending on the location you shoot e.g if you shoot the top part of the speakers, it blows up faster. The graphics are amazing (when they're isnt any fps issues) The game feels much more alive instead of having weird NPC standing around like in JC2. Combat transport. There is a great variety from tanks to OP helicopters. Cons  the worst thing about the game is the FPS performance. It doesn't matter if you have a high-end PC or a low-end PC, JC3 is just really bad at keeping the performance steady. The story itself is so bad. JC2 story felt alot longer and more serious. I feel like in JC3 all you do is go around blowing up stuff with a few epic moments here and there. Don't get me started on the deaths scenes, none of them were emotional at all. The story is really short. You can literally complete it in a day. Public transport is really bad. Driving mechanics are so bad, motorcycles do random 180 turns if you turn slightly and cars dont turn at all. Character development is really monotone. There isn't any progressing towards any of the side characters to make you feel attached to them.I hope you have enjoyed my review of Just Cause 3. I was NOT going to recommend it however, there are things such as the map that is so beautiful it has to be a 6 instead of a 5.  Story Graphics Performance Soundtrack Enjoyment Overall   5 9 3 7 8 6.4

content:
Posted: December 12, 2016
												I kinda liked Just cause 2. Although the story was rather forgettable, I found the whole freeroaming faffing-about gameplay to be rather entertaining. I would have liked it a hell of a lot more if it wasn't for the absolute mind-numbing chrashes every 20 minutes (The exact time varied from 10 to 40 min, but almost all of them occured just when I was about to have fun.).In short, fun game held back by absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥bleedingly annoying technical issues.Is JC3 any different?Well the gameplay has received a significant amount of polish. Movement is much more fluid and entertaining (especially with the addition of the wingsuit), and combat feels like an actual part of game instead of an afterthought. Another major improvement on its predecessor is that the characters are actually suprisingly well written and  voice-acted this time around, meaning that you actually give a toss about them. The technical aspect however, still makes me want to repeatedly slam my (or preferebly someone else's) head into a desk. Although crashes are no longer as frequent as they were in JC2, they still have a tendency to occur at the worst possible moments. However there is a much bigger problem. Initially I expierienced some minor framedrops, which seemed only logical since my PC isn't that great (i5-6400&GTX 750ti), so I turned the graphics down a bit (from high-medium to low). However, as time went on, the framerate became a lot worse  to the point of it being uplayable after 6 hours, even with all the graphical settings turned down the bare minimum. I know it is very common for games to suffer in performance as time goes on, but I've never experienced such a ridiclulous dropoff in performance in such a short timespan. Apparently  the game has issues with ram usage, but since I got 16 GB of RAM I would find this highly unlikely. So then I tried running it on a more beefed up (although a bit older) rig (i7-3500&GTX970) to see if that would change anything. It did. For six hours at least, after which the framerate became so un-♥♥♥♥ing-bearable I had to turn everything down to minimum AGAIN in order to maintain an average of 50 fps. And remeber, this is ONE FULL YEAR after launch. I heard this game had some performance issues but I expected it to be resolved by now. All that happend after launch was the devs releasing DLC instead of actually fixing their bloody game. I know some of the blame lies with the publisher, since the western branch of Square Enix is quite agressive when it comes to pushing potential profit over game quality, a key example being Deus Ex: Mankind Divided with a quite frankly cartoonishly evil pre-order scheme, splitting the orginal game into 2 parts, and some ridiculous one-time use microtransaction ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Also, Steam cloud sync doesnt appear to work properly for me with this game, dunno whats up with thatIn short, if you have a PC that actuallly can run the ♥♥♥♥ing thing, Just Cause 3 is a pretty fun game. Otherwise, don't buy it.
