content:
Posted: April 3, 2016
												Just cause 3 is the "homecoming" of Rico Rodriguez, and it is set in his homeland. The Just Cause franchise is known for being an open world sandbox with destructible environment, and in the first hour you are given the freedom to do whatever you want. In my oppinion, it is one of my favourite games on the PC, i repeat, on the PC, i became a PC gamer on november on 2015, i give it a 9,5/10, and here's why:Pros: It's a very fun game, with tons of explosions, and the destructible environment make it seem believable. You can fly wherever you want from the first hour of the game. Some challenges are really cool, especially the wingsuit ones, i became a master at them, my lowest score being 4/5. You are not told to play the main story, you need to play only like 4-5 missions until you get all the mission upgrades, the last one being the ability to save cars in your garage. You can drive any vehicle you see. Flying and sailing controls are really good, the driving ones are okay, but they are very, very sensitive and require a lot of practice. The wingsuit is very fun The bases are the best part in the game in my oppinion, you need to destroy almost anything that is "red" to complete the base, and then you will be given challenges(everywhere), vehicle unlocks(at military bases), and garages(at cities). You can destroy things in the way you like, and you can get very creative in this game. You can attach anything with your grappling hook.Cons: The story is very boring and unattractive.-Rico can take a lot, and recover from it in 2 seconds, more realism would be better. There is an empty area in the game. You get huge 2-3 huge bases from the beggining without liberating, it would be fun if you had to liberate them too, the military bases are the best.Summary:I recommend you buy this game at any price. It is worth it!

												Pros and Cons have been editedl, and thankfully now the game is playable.Just Cause 3 is open world, action and shoot em up game set in a fiction island called Medici, which is basically Fascist Italy and Falange Spain with some Cuban elements and a leader who read Kim Jong Un's biography. The goal of them game? BOMB THE F**K OUT OF EVERYTHING. Just Cause 2 remains better, but JC3 is definitely rivalling it, and definitely better than the original. Take this scenario: You're back from work, tired and stressed out. You're angry at the communist muslim reptile man Obama for taking your money and spending it on mexicans so they can steal your job. What do you do? Carpet Bomb civilians, because ya know, freedom. Bored with nothing to do? Carpet Bomb civilians. Homework you don't want to do? Carpet Bomb Civilians.Want to enjoy a good storyline? Get a different game... After carpet bombing civilians.Just Cause 3 is a solid 8/10, reasons below.+Different types of assault rifles and shotguns+You can call in bomb raids anywhere+Name on other game except fallout where you can detonate a nuke+You don't need to worry about money, just call in rebel drops for free fighter jets.+Grenade Mods.+A ton of easter eggs to find.+One of your missions involves kissing a cow and delivering alcohol while avoiding a truck that explodes+Italian Sportscar racing simulator 2015-Story could be less predictable, but is a huge improvement and is longer than the last two-Placing your triggered explosives on helicopters takes about 50 attempts-Physics are once again a huge improvement, but still really annoying.-----ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW-----As of now, I wish I opted for the PS4 version.PROSIts Just CauseMASSIVE EXPLOSIONSCool carsRebel Drop is a better alternative to black marketDifferent types of Assault Rifles, Handguns etc.CONSWingsuit is hard to get used toNeeds a JC2 control layoutGonna wait for a patch... Right now it's unplayable and hard to enjoy. Back to Just Cause 2 I suppose.

content:
Posted: March 3, 2016
												I just completed the game with 100% province and story completion, so my opinion in light of that:The Good: This is a spectacle shooter. If you like explosions, Rambo-like action, think 80s shooter movie, then you'll enjoy that aspect. The graphics are much better than Just Cause 2, and there are a few (not many) tweaks and changes made to your arsenal to open up some possiblities.The Bad: This isn't much of an evolution from Just Cause 2. It isn't worth $60, although it held my attention for 25+ hours, I do think it is a solid pick in the $30-$40 range, but I'd wait for a Steam Sale.The story is by-the-numbers, and there isn't much in the way of depth. Not much changed from the first province taken to the last. By the end I was just tired and wanting to complete it. The best part of the game is the voice acting of the Medici radio announcer, which is no surprise since I'm a Doctor Who fan. I was more concerned about his fate than the rest of the story. In any event, pick it up on a sale and if you go in with low expectations you'll have a great time. If there were a star rating, I'd give it a 3/5.

content:
Posted: December 15, 2016
												Despite some of the PC issues, I still think this is a fantastic expansion from Just Cause 2. It looks to me like the developers took into account the JC2 mods that were most popular, and made an official implementation for them and added a new map and storyline to make JC3. For example:The multi-grapple mod in JC2 is an upgrade you get get in JC3!The super-strength grapples mod in JC2 is an upgrade in JC3 also!The superman mod in JC2 is the wingsuit, of course without the propulsion. It helps you cover distance faster (and is so much fun), which is why I got the superman mod in JC2. Here's some pros and cons....Pros:-Great upgrade system!-Great graphics!-My rig (NVIDIA GTX 980, i5-4460, 8GB ram, 144hz monitor) handles it very well, hitting 80-110fps on absolute max settings (measured using nvidia geforce experience fps overlay). Of course, I waited a few months to get the game because I had heard it had bad performance on PC, so they must have patched some of the issues. Cons:-Terrible vehicle control. I mean, atrocious. Doing the races in JC3 isn't that fun. (But who needs a car when you have a wingsuit:)-Occasional crashes. -Fairly long load time for HDD users. -Spawns are still just as annoying as they were in JC2. Don't you love it when you see a spot in a military facility that you'd love to plant some explosives on, then see that no enemy units are there, then land and plant the first bomb. Suddenly the military is crawling out from behind all the buildings like the goblins in the mines of Moria, then you subsequently die from being riddled with bullets like Arnold Schwarzenegger and Chuck Norris had a grudge against you with an automatic 50 cal with incendiary armor piercing adamantium rounds (if you understand all those references, you rock! )-Moderately short campaign, which is made up for by all the free play you feel compelled to do after the campaign is done. -One serious bug that made one of the campaign missions unplayable (jet rockets wouldn't lock-on due to precision aim upgrade). I simply had to deactivate the upgrade temporarily for that mission. There's probably other cons I've simply forgotten because the game is so dang good! There is sooooo much experimenting you can do with the retracting grapple with the strength mods! I regularly like to drag civilian cars to the top of buildings XDOverall rating:So much fun, but -1 due to some bugs and bad vehicle control. 9/10 would grapple-retraction-launch civilians 700 meters again

Posted: December 30, 2016
												Don't get me wrong, this game can be fun and entertaining (especially so if you like explosions). However, it's still terribly buggy and laggy after a full year of being released and the gameplay also becomes repetitive (as expected from a game like this).I get as low as a 'cinematic' 25fps in cities (with explosions) with a GTX 1080 at 1080p. As for bugs, the most glaring one to me is that I'm stuck playing the game windowed, because if I put it fullscreen it makes the image blurry and the UI unusable because it offsets my mouse cursor and some buttons just dont work. Unfortunately, there is no borderless mode (I haven't looked into it, maybe there is with launch options) and the game doesn't lock your mouse cursor so I find myself clicking off screen and freezing the game occasionally.The gameplay itself is fun but gets repetitive (think of Far Cry) after liberating a few cities. If there were more variety in the cities, and there is some, but if there was a big enough differences for me to be able to say "Oh, this is where I had to do XX to liberate it." The story (I have yet to finish it) isn't really engaging but it drives along the game a bit, mostly it's just "Kill this person" or "Hijack this tank", the generic stuff.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
												Fun, pretty, almost well made game.So I've been playing this game for about 12 hours straight since I bought it, when compared to Just Cause 2, it feels much more alive, unlike the island nation of Panau, places you liberate, stay nice and populated and there are always cars on the road, so it feels more like a real place.I've had a lot of fun blowing things up as the devs really tried this time to make you care about the story just a little bit, but when you get a game that has a huge focus on blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up, you can't really expect me to follow the plot and remember who any of the characters are, I barely remember the protagonists' name, and that's only because they keep calling you by name, that's the reason I know his name at all, but it's so painfully irreverent, that you forget it instantly.Some of the design choices are questionable, I'm talking about the controls that take some getting used to, since the space bar is used to open the parachute on foot and inside cars, the handbrake is Shift, so naturally when you want to use the handbrake, you're going to find yourself jumping out of the car and opening the parachute, and you can change the open parachute in car to shift and handbrake to spacebar, but holding down spacebar will still open the parachute in the car, you have to change both on foot and in car settings if you want anything to work, so that's probobly due to the fact that this game was clearly developed for the consoles, and then poorly ported to PC, another evidence to that is how much of a resource hog this game is! I heard people with 980Ti and 1080 having problems with it, so me with my 780Ti had my work cut out for me, but when I started playing, it didn't seem bad, on ultra I got 30 fps, after some fine tuning, I got to 60... but they it started to rain! This game has one of the cheapest looking rain effects in recent years, but it just eats away at your GPU! From a good and stable 60fps, I got 5-10 when the rain started! After turning the water effects off, I got normal frame rate again. They are slowly fixing the issues with the game, so it's getting better.My final advice is: Do not spend full price on this, a developer that does a lazy job on a port, is one that does not deserve the 60$ price he asks for, if the game is above 20$, do not pay for it, I got it on sale for 15$, that's around the price it's worth

content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
												I think this game is more fun than its predecessor. However, that's just when the framerate is normal...This game has some serious memory problems. I've got a pretty decent computer, so normally the game can render 60 fps. However, it frequently drops or freezes as soon as the game spawns new actors or geometry or something else happens. I did stomp the settings to almost lowest possible and it helped a little (probably mostly because of texture size), but I still get jerky FPS.For extra irritation, you can't properly customize your keybindings in the game. If you do, the game adds two entries in the keymap file that the game isn't able to read. This leads to the game defaulting the controls every time you start the game. Also, there are multiple entries that can be changed in the config file that doesn't appear in the custom key binding screens, which means that the keys you happen to bind on those keys may get interrupted. Like (hold) Detonate Explosives on F (you can only rebind (tap) Detonate Explosives), and Look At on R.There is a workaround for this, by editing an unmodified kepmap.txt (not a typo), but it shouldn't be needed. I can't see how the config thing can be that hard to fix that it isn't sorted out a half year after release.Until these things are fixed, I would not recommend anyone getting this game. If they do fix these issues, I would happily recommend the game, because it is really fun (to me at least) when I don't experience those frustration elements.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2016
												Good game? Yes.Well performing game? Eh not really, quite demanding of resources so frames will be low throughout, putting graphics on medium and turning of V-sync slightly helps, and going offline also seems to give some performance boost, but the poor performance is most noticeable when you are in the heat of a battle.Ok so a bit more in depth now:Driving mechanics- for quite a few reviewers there seems to be issues with controlling vehicles. Personally I use keyboard and mouse and it works fine, though I did need to remap some controls to suit me I got used to it pretty quick.Flying (vehicle) mechanics- by far better than driving, maybe because there is less that you can crash into, until you get onto planes. The boost gear mod makes you crash into the runway whenever I try to take off.Vehicles in general: Planes are annoying, you can hijack pretty much any vehicle instantly, military vehicles are overpowered as all heck but I'm down with that.Flying (wingsuit) mechanics- Ok so the vehicles aren't great but the character certainly is   so long as you dont ragdoll a hundred feet into water that is   . Personally the wingsuit is my favourite method of travel, the feeling of seeing Rico (your character) glide so close to the ground, grappling along elegantly is absolutely brilliant, one of the most satisying feats I have personally done in probably all my time gaming came from my first few hours playing this game when I managed to fly over a bridge alongside some cars.Ragdoll mechanics- These are annoying pretty much every time you fail anything and get sent sprawling across the floor, especially when you get into combat, it is all just a bit too long and slow.Combat mechanics- Pretty much the same as any other third person shooter, with a few differences such as the grapple hooks and no melee at all, save a kick/shove. Tanks shoot things, helicopters/choppers fly and shoot things, lots of explosions etc.Territory system/map control- Not particularly exciting, you can just keep flying into a certain base, shoot one target, die, come back, shoot another over and over until you get everything should you so wish. Dying results in no penalties, leaving enemy territory half broken doesnt result in the enemy rebuilding it and liberating territories as a whole is a bit too easy, but this game really isnt meant to be taken too seriously.Civilians- Generic talk, generic player play foddle, but this time you can tie them together, attatch them to a car and drive them off a cliff.Action vs Wandering about- the map is big, you can teleport places and call in vehicles but these require flares and such which are quite difficult to find so you will do a lot of running or flying or driving or, Leonardo Da Vinci forbid, swimming, but even so there is plenty to do, and you wont have to travel far to find a place to liberate, unless you find yourself going back on yourself.DLC- they seem worthit, though short. They do provide some content but the Sky Fortress dlc took me about an hour tops to complete. Eden so they are fun.Collectibles- There are a lot, dont go crazy trying to get them all because it will ruin the experience. Just take yer time I'd say.Overall: It is a good game, possibly get it when on sale though, and be prepared to face some (pretty major) lag and fps drops. Even so it is still a good game, and I recommend.

content:
Posted: December 26, 2016
												Fun, pretty, almost well made game.So I've been playing this game for about 12 hours straight since I bought it, when compared to Just Cause 2, it feels much more alive, unlike the island nation of Panau, places you liberate, stay nice and populated and there are always cars on the road, so it feels more like a real place.I've had a lot of fun blowing things up as the devs really tried this time to make you care about the story just a little bit, but when you get a game that has a huge focus on blowing♥♥♥♥♥♥up, you can't really expect me to follow the plot and remember who any of the characters are, I barely remember the protagonists' name, and that's only because they keep calling you by name, that's the reason I know his name at all, but it's so painfully irreverent, that you forget it instantly.Some of the design choices are questionable, I'm talking about the controls that take some getting used to, since the space bar is used to open the parachute on foot and inside cars, the handbrake is Shift, so naturally when you want to use the handbrake, you're going to find yourself jumping out of the car and opening the parachute, and you can change the open parachute in car to shift and handbrake to spacebar, but holding down spacebar will still open the parachute in the car, you have to change both on foot and in car settings if you want anything to work, so that's probobly due to the fact that this game was clearly developed for the consoles, and then poorly ported to PC, another evidence to that is how much of a resource hog this game is! I heard people with 980Ti and 1080 having problems with it, so me with my 780Ti had my work cut out for me, but when I started playing, it didn't seem bad, on ultra I got 30 fps, after some fine tuning, I got to 60... but they it started to rain! This game has one of the cheapest looking rain effects in recent years, but it just eats away at your GPU! From a good and stable 60fps, I got 5-10 when the rain started! After turning the water effects off, I got normal frame rate again. They are slowly fixing the issues with the game, so it's getting better.My final advice is: Do not spend full price on this, a developer that does a lazy job on a port, is one that does not deserve the 60$ price he asks for, if the game is above 20$, do not pay for it, I got it on sale for 15$, that's around the price it's worth

												Don't get me wrong, this game can be fun and entertaining (especially so if you like explosions). However, it's still terribly buggy and laggy after a full year of being released and the gameplay also becomes repetitive (as expected from a game like this).I get as low as a 'cinematic' 25fps in cities (with explosions) with a GTX 1080 at 1080p. As for bugs, the most glaring one to me is that I'm stuck playing the game windowed, because if I put it fullscreen it makes the image blurry and the UI unusable because it offsets my mouse cursor and some buttons just dont work. Unfortunately, there is no borderless mode (I haven't looked into it, maybe there is with launch options) and the game doesn't lock your mouse cursor so I find myself clicking off screen and freezing the game occasionally.The gameplay itself is fun but gets repetitive (think of Far Cry) after liberating a few cities. If there were more variety in the cities, and there is some, but if there was a big enough differences for me to be able to say "Oh, this is where I had to do XX to liberate it." The story (I have yet to finish it) isn't really engaging but it drives along the game a bit, mostly it's just "Kill this person" or "Hijack this tank", the generic stuff.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
												I think this game is more fun than its predecessor. However, that's just when the framerate is normal...This game has some serious memory problems. I've got a pretty decent computer, so normally the game can render 60 fps. However, it frequently drops or freezes as soon as the game spawns new actors or geometry or something else happens. I did stomp the settings to almost lowest possible and it helped a little (probably mostly because of texture size), but I still get jerky FPS.For extra irritation, you can't properly customize your keybindings in the game. If you do, the game adds two entries in the keymap file that the game isn't able to read. This leads to the game defaulting the controls every time you start the game. Also, there are multiple entries that can be changed in the config file that doesn't appear in the custom key binding screens, which means that the keys you happen to bind on those keys may get interrupted. Like (hold) Detonate Explosives on F (you can only rebind (tap) Detonate Explosives), and Look At on R.There is a workaround for this, by editing an unmodified kepmap.txt (not a typo), but it shouldn't be needed. I can't see how the config thing can be that hard to fix that it isn't sorted out a half year after release.Until these things are fixed, I would not recommend anyone getting this game. If they do fix these issues, I would happily recommend the game, because it is really fun (to me at least) when I don't experience those frustration elements.

												The game looks and feels nice IF you get past all the **** it throws at you when you start:I've played for about 10 minutes and here's a list of bugs I found: The game doesn't launch in full-screen mode and will probably take you ~20 minutes to launch it. content:
Posted: April 16
												9/10(10/10 IF I CUD GET ♥♥♥♥ING 60 FPS... nah its k)While Just Cause 2 made up for its lack of gameplay features (few weapons, lack of base variety, unpolished mechanics) with a beautiful open world, some pretty cool explosive action and great mod support, Just Cause 3 initially seemed worse to me.Here is what I thought before getting the game for 10 bucks:- they got rid of the roll mechanic (some of the coolest moments are with slow motion mod and dodging bullets with rolls matrix style)- they got rid of the sprint ability (ahem... superspeed mod was badass)- the wingsuit renders driving pointless- other than this, the game looked just like JC2 with better graphics and bad performanceBoy, was I wrong. This game is fu(king phenomenal.Removing the roll and sprint make complete sense to me now. Using your grapple to evade attacks is much cooler and the game overall moves faster than Just Cause 2, so there is no point for being able to supersprint.There are performance issues, yes, but I have a modest GTX 970 and the game runs pretty solidly at almost maxed out settings, so unless you're some graphics junkie there is no reason to complain.The star of the show, however, is the new wingsuit. Not only is it an absolute blast to fly with, but it also adds new gameplay ideas, as the parachute was never a good way to move horizontally in the last game.There are also many cool smaller things added, such as a lot more weapons (like the Leech, fu(king amazing) and an improved rebel drop system, improved handling and vehicle models, plus retractable grapples, adding a whole new aspect to connecting things to cause mayhem. While in Just Cause 2 you could only connect things, in this one you can do this plus cause the grapple rope to tighten and crash the two objects (or people) into each other.When the game was first released I fell in love with its soundtrack (Firestarter is so good), but the game seemed like too much of the same coupled with $hitty performance. I was wrong, and I am happy I was, because this has become one of my all time favorite games, and blows Just Cause 2 out of the water in every single way.Get it on sale :D.... its 12 bucks pretty often.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
												So currently, you'll see a lot of crude remarks and "reviews" about Just Cause 3 in the community hub. A lot of them have to do with them believing the game isnt fun or does not function correctly which I'm ok with, that was their experience, but I feel like it's starting to cloud the judgement of people who have a high probabillity of enjoying this great game that Avalanche studios and Square Enix have made for us.I'm here to put out my opinion on the game and I'll start with straight off saying HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.I'm totally for this game, bugs and all.So I won't do a Pros vs. Cons lists because it's a bit annoying imo to see a list of things someone doesnt like, but I will tell you what I do like.The most important feature in the game is the wingsuit now: The wingsuit is fairly easy to master and can be really fun if you know when to time your grapple shots. It's pretty quick and can get you to most places without using an air vehicle.Challenges: They're rewarded throughout your gameplay (When you liberate or take a settlement) and you essentially are playing them for mods and a bit of practice using different tools. The challenges are based on many factors and the result of getting points in them is GEARS. Gears are like a currency type for your mod menu and unlock the mods as you recieve them. You can earn up to 5 gears in a challenge, 5 being fairly difficult to achieve without practice.Mods: Modding is a new feature and is really cool! It allows you to toggle on and off certain things you want to apply to your tools such as rocket boosters to C4, a faster reel in for grappling (which applies to multiple actions like, wingsuiting, parachuting and regular grappling), and many many more. *****Do Not Confuse In-Game Modding With Workshop Mods*****Story: Much more humor has been put into the story, and the characters have more...character to them. The story could still use work for future games in the series but you now have a much firmer grasp on ricos past and the concept the Developers are going for in this game.Graphics: Absolutely lovely. If you played BattleFront beta on High settings, you may have noticed how amazing it looked kind of giving you a warm happy feeling. Thats what the graphics are like in Just Cause 3. Simply Beautiful. Unlimited C4: This is also a new feature, one of many. Rather than simply being allowed to drop C4 everywhere and finish the game in 3 hours, you now can place 3 C4 on any nearby object or drop them from above in parachute mode and detonate them from far away, maybe on a high vantage point to admire your work. You can also upgrade to 5 C4 later on.Upgraded Grappling Hook/ Multiple Tethers: The grapple hook now looks much more sleek and presents a much better feel to the player when grappling to objects. I Don't know for sure, but it also seems like the grapple distance is slightly farther. You may now upgrade to 6 Tethers throughout the game and you start off with two fairly early, say 15 minutes into the game. With these tethers you can pull objects together with the new Manual Retract Function.Weapons: Not much to say other than ammo is much more common throughout the world and there are many more weapons presented compared to Just cause 2. These can also be modded.Over All Gameplay: A very fun game, full of moments where you question what your true abillities really are! You may ask yourself whether or not you can accomplish a task, truth is you most likely can. The gameplay is rewarding and well worth your money (Remember it's in my opinion) and runs really smoothly....MOST OF THE TIME. This leads us to the bugs ........*************. DEVS THIS IS FOR YOU..***************................BUGS:People will often play music but are not holding instrumentsWhen Slingsuiting up at afairly steep angle, Rico completely flips around backwards instantly making recovery difficultThe vehicle driving could use a bit of a touch up, but I think it's a major improvement over JC2!NPCs will sometimes vanish when a physical object hits the ground near them.HOPE THIS HELPS THE CAUSE~Blue JayMy Computer is a ROG ♥♥♥♥j and I run at around HIGH with 60 fps

content:
Posted: March 25
												The graphics are nice, the game has some stunning vistas and the wingsuit is a lot of fun. Unfortunately that's where my praise for the game has to end.This game has innumerable issues that just make every gameplay session frustrating, most notably:-The basic feature of weapon zooming was locked behind an upgrade, and although it's easy to obtain, this leaves new players lacking the most basic and fundemental shooting mechanics. -DLC. I bought a version of the game with a season pass, and expected to get all of the DLC, yet there's still tons of vehicles and weapons that aren't included, I find this underhanded and deceptive. -Performance, I'm running an 8350 and an RX 480, yet even in the lowest settings with all of the performanc tweaks I was able to find online, I get drops to the low 20s. This is inexcusable. The game also has a memory leak that was never patched that will continue to eat your system RAM until your PC crashes. -No sprint and no roll. I looked into this, and the devs stated that not including these features that were present in Just Cause 2 was due to them wanting to "encourage the players to use the grapple mechanic, flying is Rico's cover". Well that's just a load of bull, you're never more vulnerable than you are when you're airborne, if you try to use the parachute to escape a gunfight you just make yourself an easier target. On the ground you move at a brisk jog, and there's no dodge mechanic to let you avoid gunfire. This makes every engagement an exercise in frustration as you lack the agility to play the way you would in JC2 and the game's flight mechanics do not remotely work as stated where combat is concerned.-Nauseating, disorientating FoV. This can be fixed with a mod, but the fact that it passed playtesting in its current state, and that there is no FoV slider in the game is inexcusable. I found driving cars next to impossible with the default FoV, so narrow that I couldn't see anything that was going on around me.-Bad controls. They're just bad, I don't know how else to explain it, this is a situation where you have to play it for yourself to truly appreciate all the little annoyances and bizarre choices. I tried playing both with the M&KB and an Xbox controller, and it's irredeemable. Every vehicle has this odd oversteer, like the deadzone is all wrong, and the grapple that is supposed to be your primary mode of transportation frequently hooks to things that weren't even close to where you were aiming the cursor. Rico slips off the geometry of the map, slides down the edge of a building rather than jumping up on top of it because your grapple was a fraction of an inch too low, sometimes the grapple won't deploy and you die as a result, he gets ragdolled and rolls for minutes at a time while you hammer buttons in a futile effort to shoot a hook or get him to stand up before he dies, sometimes when you deploy a grapple while parachuting you lose all momentum and drop out of the air, it's just a mess. Shooting is imprecise with the controller, and there's mouse smoothing that makes shooting accurately very hard. I never feel like I have any real control over what's happening, it's all just a gamble that Rico will do what I want him to at any given moment. I'm sure there's a lot more to unpack here, but I don't care to play much further in order to find out. Very disappointed, I thought getting the game on sale with the seaon pass for 70% off was a good deal but I regret the purchase.

content:
Posted: April 3, 2016
												Just cause 3 is the "homecoming" of Rico Rodriguez, and it is set in his homeland. The Just Cause franchise is known for being an open world sandbox with destructible environment, and in the first hour you are given the freedom to do whatever you want. In my oppinion, it is one of my favourite games on the PC, i repeat, on the PC, i became a PC gamer on november on 2015, i give it a 9,5/10, and here's why:Pros: It's a very fun game, with tons of explosions, and the destructible environment make it seem believable. You can fly wherever you want from the first hour of the game. Some challenges are really cool, especially the wingsuit ones, i became a master at them, my lowest score being 4/5. You are not told to play the main story, you need to play only like 4-5 missions until you get all the mission upgrades, the last one being the ability to save cars in your garage. You can drive any vehicle you see. Flying and sailing controls are really good, the driving ones are okay, but they are very, very sensitive and require a lot of practice. The wingsuit is very fun The bases are the best part in the game in my oppinion, you need to destroy almost anything that is "red" to complete the base, and then you will be given challenges(everywhere), vehicle unlocks(at military bases), and garages(at cities). You can destroy things in the way you like, and you can get very creative in this game. You can attach anything with your grappling hook.Cons: The story is very boring and unattractive.-Rico can take a lot, and recover from it in 2 seconds, more realism would be better. There is an empty area in the game. You get huge 2-3 huge bases from the beggining without liberating, it would be fun if you had to liberate them too, the military bases are the best.Summary:I recommend you buy this game at any price. It is worth it!

content:
Posted: December 15, 2016
												Despite some of the PC issues, I still think this is a fantastic expansion from Just Cause 2. It looks to me like the developers took into account the JC2 mods that were most popular, and made an official implementation for them and added a new map and storyline to make JC3. For example:The multi-grapple mod in JC2 is an upgrade you get get in JC3!The super-strength grapples mod in JC2 is an upgrade in JC3 also!The superman mod in JC2 is the wingsuit, of course without the propulsion. It helps you cover distance faster (and is so much fun), which is why I got the superman mod in JC2. Here's some pros and cons....Pros:-Great upgrade system!-Great graphics!-My rig (NVIDIA GTX 980, i5-4460, 8GB ram, 144hz monitor) handles it very well, hitting 80-110fps on absolute max settings (measured using nvidia geforce experience fps overlay). Of course, I waited a few months to get the game because I had heard it had bad performance on PC, so they must have patched some of the issues. Cons:-Terrible vehicle control. I mean, atrocious. Doing the races in JC3 isn't that fun. (But who needs a car when you have a wingsuit:)-Occasional crashes. -Fairly long load time for HDD users. -Spawns are still just as annoying as they were in JC2. Don't you love it when you see a spot in a military facility that you'd love to plant some explosives on, then see that no enemy units are there, then land and plant the first bomb. Suddenly the military is crawling out from behind all the buildings like the goblins in the mines of Moria, then you subsequently die from being riddled with bullets like Arnold Schwarzenegger and Chuck Norris had a grudge against you with an automatic 50 cal with incendiary armor piercing adamantium rounds (if you understand all those references, you rock! )-Moderately short campaign, which is made up for by all the free play you feel compelled to do after the campaign is done. -One serious bug that made one of the campaign missions unplayable (jet rockets wouldn't lock-on due to precision aim upgrade). I simply had to deactivate the upgrade temporarily for that mission. There's probably other cons I've simply forgotten because the game is so dang good! There is sooooo much experimenting you can do with the retracting grapple with the strength mods! I regularly like to drag civilian cars to the top of buildings XDOverall rating:So much fun, but -1 due to some bugs and bad vehicle control. 9/10 would grapple-retraction-launch civilians 700 meters again
